snippet: The girls, who were dropped off at a house in Richville, N.Y., about 20 miles from their family farm, were driven home and handed over to a sheriff’s deputy.
abstract: St Lawrence County, NY, officials say Amish girls Delila and Fannie Miller have been found; girls disappeared the night before, and their return ended a search that was complicated by customs of Amish as well as technological problems that come with the modern world.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and KRISTIN HUSSEY
byline.contributor: Marc Santora reported from New York, and Kristin Hussey from the town of Oswegatchie, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: The girls, who were dropped off at a house in Richville, N.Y., about 20 miles from their family farm, were driven home and handed over to a sheriff’s deputy.

headline.main: Complicated Hunt for 2 Amish Sisters Ends With Their Safe Return
headline.print_headline: Without Photos, a Hindered Search for Two Amish Girls
